messages.title: My Priorities for Gedling
messages.content:
YOUR LOCAL VOICE
Gedling made me who I am. I grew up in Arnold and went to school there. After a career in the private and charity sectors, I want to use my skills to make the area I call home an even better place to live, work and raise a family.

MORE POLICE ON GEDLING'S STREETS
I want to make our streets safer and support the Conservatives' plans to recruit 107 more officers for Nottinghamshire Police by the end of 2020-21. I'll also support stronger sentencing, sending a clear message that we are coming after criminals.

MORE FUNDING FOR SCHOOLS
Every child should have the chance to succeed in life. The Conservatives' £14 billion cash injection for schools will lift per pupil funding in Gedling, from £4,800 to £5,598 for secondary school pupils.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improve the local area, making it a better place to live, work, and raise a family.
Increase the number of police officers and support stronger sentencing.
Provide a £14 billion cash injection for schools to increase per pupil funding.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for Labour means another hung parliament. With Corbyn propped up by parties like the Scottish Nationalists. And they're demanding ANOTHER referendum to break up Britain. That's five long years of gridlock and uncertainty.
